i1.blurb: While in combat Gnar generates Rage. At maximum Rage his next ability will transform him into Mega Gnar, granting increased survivability and access to new spells.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}:}} While in '''Mini Gnar''' form, he gains '''bonus''' {{sti|ms|{{as|movement speed}}}}, {{sti|range|attack range}}, {{as|attack speed growth}} and {{sti|{{as|attack speed}}}}.

{{sbc|Innate:}} '''Mini Gnar''' generates {{pp|3|4 to 11|1 to 11}} ''{{ai|Rage Gene|Gnar|Rage}}'' over 2 seconds upon dealing or receiving [[damage]]. Against non-[[champion]]s, basic attacks and {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generate {{pp|3|0.5;0.875;1.375|1 to 11}} ''Rage''. Against champions, {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generates {{pp|3|1;1.75;2.75|1 to 11}} ''Rage'', and basic attacks instantly generate {{pp|3|2;3.5;5.5|1 to 11}}. {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} can only generate ''Rage'' once per cast, and grants ''Rage'' based on the first enemy hit. '''Gnar's''' ''Rage'' decays if he has not dealt or taken damage in the last 13 seconds.

At maximum ''{{ai|Rage Gene 2|Gnar|Rage}}'', casting an ability or after 4 seconds will ''{{ai|Rage Gene 3|Gnar|transform}}'' him into {{ci|Mega Gnar}} for 15 seconds, during which '''Gnar's''' ''Rage'' depletes. Afterwards '''Gnar''' returns to '''Mini Gnar''' and is too ''{{ai|Rage Gene 4|Gnar|tired}}'' to generate ''Rage'' for 15 seconds. '''Gnar''' retains his {{sti|health|{{as|current '''percentage''' health}}}} when he returns to '''Mini Gnar'''.

{{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}}:}} '''Mega Gnar''' has different abilities, although they share ''Mini Gnar's'' ability cooldowns. While in '''Mega Gnar''' form, he loses all '''Mini Gnar's''' buffs and instead has increased {{sti|ad|{{as|'''base''' AD}}}}, {{sti|health|{{as|'''base''' health}}}}, {{sti|armor|{{as|'''base''' armor}}}}, and {{sti|mr|{{as|'''base''' magic resistance}}}}. '''Gnar''' [[healing|restores]] {{sti|{{as|health}}}} equal to the increase.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Movespeed|{{pp|10 to 24;26;28;30|displayformula=9 + 1 per level up to 15, then + 2 per level}}|Total Movespeed|{{pp|335 to 349;351;353;355|displayformula=334 + 1 per level up to 15, then + 2 per level}}}}{{st|Bonus Range|{{pp|225 to 325}}|Total Range|{{pp|175+225 to 175+325}}}}
i1.name: Rage Gene
notes: * The ''Rage'' generated upon dealing or receiving damage occurs over 2 seconds with 4 ticks every {{fd|0.5}} seconds. It also does not stack but instead refreshes with subsequent applications (of dealing or receiving damage).
* The bonus rage generation on basic attacks counts as an on-hit effect, and is triggered by {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} and {{ii|Guinsoo's Rageblade}}.

* Against non-champions, basic attacks and {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generate '''{{fd|12.5}}%''' of the ''Rage'' over time. While, against champions, {{ai|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} instantly generates '''25%''', and basic attacks '''50%'''.
* In-game, the value on the ''Rage'' bar always displays rounded down to the nearest integer.
* {{cis|Mega Gnar}} gained health is not affected by {{tip|Grievous Wounds}} or increased healing from items and runes.
* When returning to {{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}}, ''Gnar'' will only retain his current health percentage, not current health total.
** This is intentional to prevent Gnar from simply triggering ''Rage Gene'' in order to heal himself over time.
* '''Gnar's''' abilities share cooldowns across forms.
* The final stats, after ''Rage Gene'' being applied, can be seen on '''Gnar''' and '''Mega Gnar''' respective data template, in the [[Gnar|front page]].

** '''Mini Gnar''' gains {{pp|key=%|5.5+({{Data Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}-{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula=5.5 base+{{#expr:{{Data Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}-{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|as_lvl}}}} growth}} '''bonus''' attack speed.

** '''Mega Gnar''' gains {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|hp_lvl}}}} growth}} base health, {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|arm_lvl}}}} growth}} base armor, {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|mr_lvl}}}} growth}} base magic resistance, and {{pp|({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_base}})+({{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}})*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1))|formula={{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_base}}}} base+{{#expr:{{Data Mega Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}-{{Data Gnar|pst2|dam_lvl}}}} growth}} base attack damage.

q1.blurb: Gnar throws a boomerang that damages and slows enemies it hits before returning to him. If he catches the boomerang its cooldown is reduced.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' throws a boomerang forward in a line that deals {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} enemies for 2 seconds. The boomerang returns towards '''Gnar''' in a fixed line after reaching its maximum range or hitting an enemy, dealing 50% damage to subsequent targets.
Each enemy can only be hit once. Catching the boomerang while in mid-air refunds 40% of its {{sti|cooldown|maximum cooldown}}, while if caught at the end of its return flight it refunds completely.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|5 to 165}} {{as|(+ 115% AD)}}|Reduced Damage|{{ap|5/2 to 165/2}} {{as|(+ {{fd|57.5}}% AD)}}}}{{st|Slow|{{ap|15 to 35}}%}}
q1.name: Boomerang Throw
notes: * The boomerang return direction is determined by which direction '''Gnar''' is heading, similar to {{cai|Spinning Axe|Draven}}, and is calculated at the apex of its flight.
* Since the cooldown between the two is shared ''Mini Gnar'' may pick up a boulder and/or ''Mega Gnar'' may catch a boomerang.
* Using ''Boomerang Throw'' during {{ai|Hop|Gnar}} will cause the boomerang to travel 1100 units from the destination where '''Gnar''' jumped.
** As a result the boomerang animation glitches slightly in height.

q2.blurb: Mega Gnar instead throws a boulder that stops on the first unit hit, damaging and slowing everything nearby. It can then be picked up to reduce the cooldown.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' throws a boulder that stops when it hits an enemy, applying {{ais|Boomerang Throw|Gnar}} {{tip|slow}} to all nearby enemies and dealing {{as|physical damage}}.
'''Gnar''' can pick up the boulder by moving within 90 units of it, refunding 60% of its {{sti|cooldown|maximum cooldown}}.
q2.name: Boulder Toss
notes: * Since the cooldown between the two is shared ''Mini Gnar'' may pick up a boulder and/or ''Mega Gnar'' may catch a boomerang.
* Gnar is locked out of picking up his boulder for {{fd|0.3}} seconds after throwing it.
* The {{ai|Boulder Toss|Gnar|Boulder}} will stop if colliding with {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.

w1.blurb: Gnar's attacks and spells hype him up, dealing bonus damage and granting him Movement Speed.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Passive:}} Every {{ai|Hyper 2|Gnar|third}} attack or ability on the same target within {{fd|3.5}} seconds deals {{tip|magic damage|{{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}}} (capped against monsters) and grants '''Gnar''' {{pp|type = [[File:GNAR!.png|20px|border]] GNAR!'s rank|4|key=%|30 to 75|0 to 3|displayformula = 30%+15% per GNAR!'s rank|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over 3 seconds.
'''Gnar''' gains ''Hyper's'' {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} when he leaves {{ci|Mega Gnar|Mega}} form.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{ap|10 to 50}} {{as|(+ {{ap|6 to 14}}% of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}|Maximum Bonus Damage To Monsters|{{ap|100 to 300}} {{as|(+ 100% AP)}}}}
w1.name: Hyper
notes: * No additional details.

w2.blurb: Mega Gnar is too enraged to be hyper and instead can rear up on his hind legs and smash down on the area in front of him, stunning enemies in an area.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' slams in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies struck and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|1.25}} seconds.
w2.name: Wallop
notes: * No additional details.

e1.blurb: Gnar leaps to a location and bounces off the head of any unit he lands on, traveling further.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' {{tip|dash|leaps}} to a target location, gaining {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 3 seconds.
If '''Gnar''' lands on a unit he will {{tip|dash|bounce}} 525 units further in the same direction.
Landing on an enemy deals {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slows}} it by 80% for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
e1.name: Hop
notes: * ''Hop'' does not allow ''Gnar'' to bounce off wards.

e2.blurb: Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} '''Gnar''' {{tip|dash|leaps}} to a target location and deals ''Hop's'' damage to nearby enemies on landing.

{{sbc|Hop and Crunch:}} If ''Crunch'' is used to transform, '''Gnar''' will still be able to {{tip|dash|bounce}}. ''Crunch's'' area of effect is dealt in both areas, though enemies can only be damaged once.
Enemies '''Gnar''' lands directly on top of are dealt ''Hop's'' {{tip|slow}}.
e2.name: Crunch
notes: * ''Gnar'' is locked out of using any other abilities during ''Crunch'', but he can still transform mid-air if he reaches 100 ''Rage'' during the jump of ''Hop''.

r1.blurb: Mega Gnar throws everything around him in a chosen direction, dealing damage and slowing them. Any enemy that hits a wall is stunned and takes bonus damage.
description: {{sbc|{{ci|Gnar|Mini Gnar}} - Passive:}} Increases {{ais|Hyper|Gnar}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}.

{{sbc|{{ci|Mega Gnar}} - Active:}} After {{fd|0.4}}-seconds, '''Gnar''' {{tip|airborne|knocks}} nearby enemies up to 590 units in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 45%.
Enemies that hit a wall take 50% '''bonus''' damage and are {{tip|stun|stunned}} instead of {{tip|slow|slowed}}.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|200 to 400}} {{as|(+ 20% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 50% AP)}}|Increased Damage|{{ap|200*1.5 to 400*1.5}} {{as|(+ 30% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ 75% AP)}}}}
r1.name: GNAR!
notes: * ''GNAR!'s active'' also stuns enemies hitting impassable player-created terrain ({{ai|Crystallize|Anivia}}, {{ai|Emperor's Divide|Azir}}, {{ai|Cataclysm|Jarvan IV}}, {{ai|Pillar of Ice|Trundle}}).
